Membership & Store
Welcome to Los Alamitos Elementary School!
The Los Alamitos PTA is a non-profit volunteer organization that supports Los Alamitos Elementary School. Our PTA's goal is provide vital programs, supplies, financial support, and
promote a collaborative relationship between parents, teachers, and administrators.
Join the PTA - have a voice in shaping how we support our kids, teachers, and school.
Registration
We are excited for the 2025-2026 school year to begin on August 7th!
ALL families need to update their personal information on the PTA website for their account to be active for the 2025-26 school year.
*2025-26 PTA Membership is now open!
Please renew your membership
here
.
If you do not have a Membership Toolkit account or are new to the school,
please register now and join the PTA:
*An active account is required to receive the PTA's weekly email newsletter and access PTA store; and PTA membership is required to access the student directory, meeting minutes, and much more.
January 25, 2026
Announcements
PTA Meeting Tomorrow!
When: Monday, January 26th right after Community Monday
Where: Cafeteria
Come to the PTA meeting to hear what the PTA is up to and have a say! Find the agenda
here
!
Spelling Bee
Congratulations to our finalists
for earning a spot in the next round! What an accomplishment! Please come out and cheer them on
Tomorrow, January 26th
at 6:00 PM
at the
Los Alamitos Spelling Bee.
Let’s show up strong and support our students!
Shawn Harris is Coming to Los Alamitos!
The PTA is hosting author
Shawn Harris
for an assembly for our students on
January 27th
for the release of:
Let’s Be Bees
The only thing better than playing make believe is playing make believe with your favorite grown-up! Especially when that grown-up’s imagination is as big as yours, and you both get to make all kinds of funny sounds.
Shawn Harris is an award-winning creator of books for kids. He received a Caldecott Honor for his debut authored book Have You Ever Seen a Flower, which the New York Times called a “stunning tour de force.” His work as an illustrator includes What Can a Citizen Do?, Her Right Foot, and the Newbery Medal-winning bestseller The Eyes and the Impossible, all written by Dave Eggers; A Polar Bear in the Snow by Mac Barnett; and Everyone’s Awake by Colin Meloy, among others.
TK-2 grade assemblies will focus on Let's Be Bees and 3-5 grade assemblies will focus on The First Cat in Space series!
Order your very own book signed by Shawn Harris! The deadline to order books is tomorrow, Monday Jan 19th!
Books will be delivered to Los Alamitos. You can purchase books by Shawn Harris at:
hicklebees.com/shawnharris-
losalamitos
Bubblefest Update
Bubblefest takes place this
Friday, January 30
in the cafeteria. There is less than a week before the big day, and we still need more volunteers to sign up. We especially need help setting up after school Thursday and cleaning up after the event on Friday right after school. Here’s the sign-up link:
https://signup.com/go/AHeWeDU
. Thank you to everyone who has already signed up to help.
I also want to thank Anjana Ramamurthi and Sadie Fenton for volunteering to take over as the Bubblefest coordinators next year. We really appreciate you keeping Bubblefest alive!
Four Seasons Fundraising Concert at Castillero
Our community is invited to attend the
Four Seasons Fundraising Concert
on
Friday, January 30, 2026, at 7:30 PM
at
Venture Church
.
The concert will feature the
Castillero Middle School Orchestras
, showcasing a high-quality program of classical and contemporary music. Many of our elementary students continue on to Castillero, and this is a great opportunity for families to see the excellent music program they may join in the future.
Guest performers will include
two-time Grammy-winning jazz violinist Mads Tolling
.
Please see the attached flyer for additional details, including time, location, and QR code.
Families who are unable to attend but wish to support the program may donate using the information provided.
Hope to see you there,
The Castillero Middle school
Galentine's Night Out at F45 Branham Park!
45 minutes of strength training work out followed by bubbles
Each F45 workout is a unique program that incorporates cardio, resistance- based strength training, or a hybrid of both, all geared toward everyday life. No two workouts are the same, keeping members challenged and having fun. All of the F45 coaches are certified personal trainers who have the skills to safely modify each movement to any member’s individual needs. Our goal is to help you become your fittest, strongest and healthiest self!
This is a free event on 2/12 with a maximum of 30 people, so sign up now!
To sign up, text "LAMOMS" to 408.549.7760
Yearbook Cover Contest (5th Graders Only)
(Entries due by February 23, 2026)
Los Alamitos PTA is inviting all Los Alamitos 5th graders to enter their drawings in our Yearbook cover contest. 2 winners will be selected to be displayed on the front and back cover, by the Yearbook committee panel.
Submit art on
:
• 8.5 X 11 sheet of white paper
• Use the paper vertically
All entries must include:
• Theme: Under the Sea
• The words “Los Alamitos”
• School Year: 2025-2026
Tips for good entry
:
• Not a lot of white space- lots of color (including background)
• Mix up your medium (crayons, watercolors, markers, oil pastels etc)
• Use up the whole sheet of paper (the bigger the better)
• Do not put your name/grade/teacher on the drawing
Questions? E-mail:
LosAlamitosPTA@gmail.c
om
Variety Show – Volunteers & Important Info
We’re gearing up for our upcoming Variety Show on
Friday, March 20th
and need parent volunteers to help make it a success!
Volunteer opportunities include:
MCs (Hosts) - to introduce our talented students
Stage Hands - to assist performers
AV Support - for sound and visual support
Concession Organizer - to coordinate snacks and sales
In addition, we are also looking for a volunteer who can provide a digital keyboard for the event.
Please reach out to
Sara Buxton at
salpibuxton@gmail.com
if interested in any of the above.
To Apply to the Variety Show:
Do you have a talent to share?
Sing, Rap, Dance, Lip Sync, Magic, Musical Instrument, Cheer Performance, Skit, Monologue, Jump Rope, Yo Yo, Puppet show, Comedy Routine, Impressions, Mime, Martial Arts demo, Poetry, Baton twirling.
Come show us what you’ve got!
Important Dates!
Audition Videos: Due by Friday, March 6th, 2026
Dress Rehearsal: Thursday, March 19th, 2026 @ 4:00pm
Show: Friday, March 20th, 2026 @ 4:00pm
Where: The Stage at Los Alamitos
SIGN UP: To Sign Up, Use the Link
HERE
Math Kangaroo Competition is Coming to Los Alamitos!
Following are the steps to register for the Math kangaroo competition.
1. Go to
Math Kangaroo registration
2.Create an account if you are new user
3. Click on the by invitation button on the left panel.
4. Copy and paste this code in the field invitation.
CODE : CASAN_J0017001@2026math
5. Do not share this code with anyone. Limited spots available at our school.
Event Date: March 19,2025
Event Time: 2:30 - 3:45
Venue: Library
if you need any additional information please reach out Harini(
harini.mouli@gmail.com
)
Reading Lab Volunteers Needed!
The Reading Lab is a tutoring program for students who would benefit from extra help with fundamental reading skills.
We are looking for volunteers who can come in
once per week (Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday) from 12:45pm - 2:00pm
during the school year. Training for new tutors is provided!! Helping these new & growing readers is super fun and rewarding!
***Volunteers must be registered with the district and approved by Los Alamitos.***
If you're interested in volunteering, please sign up here:
https://forms.gle/FqpLea77Sxjt
wJTR9
For questions, please contact Chris Chen at
cchris@sbcglobal.net
or 408-981-2080 (mobile - please leave a message the first time), or you can find out more information about the program
here
.
Yearbook Orders
It’s that time of year!
Order your 2025–26 Yearbook today and save all the memories.
Last day to order: 4/20 — but don’t wait until the last minute! We won’t have extras on hand if you forget to order.
5th grade parents — start gathering those adorable baby photos for the 5th Grade Baby Pages! They are due by
March 1st!
Please send them to your classroom parent yearbook rep and include your child's full name with the photo.
https://www.betteryearbook.com
/
New Kiln!
We have a new kiln for our Art Vistas Program and we are so excited for many more art projects!!
Middle School Selection Process
5th grade parents, you should have received this information through Parent Square, but here is a friendly reminder about middle school selection:
How to Submit School Choices
Families will submit school choice requests online through the School Choice section of Parent Portal, which will be open from January 20 through February 13, 2026. An active Parent Portal account is required.
If you do not yet have a Parent Portal account, please visit the link below for instructions on setting up your account:
https://www.sjusd.
org/resources/parent-
resources/parent-portal
If you experience technical issues or have questions after reviewing the training materials, please contact
parentportal@sjusd.org
or call (408) 535-6000 ext. 17490. Please note that an email address is required to create a Parent Portal account.
Sponsor Spotlight
We are so grateful to our generous sponsors whose support helps make our PTA programs and events possible. Your contributions strengthen our school community and create lasting experiences for our students. Thank you for investing in our kids and in Los Alamitos!
Steinhoff Orthodontics
Straight smiles start here! Steinhoff Orthodontics delivers expert, personalized care for kids and adults alike - from braces to clear aligners. Their friendly team makes every visit comfortable and confidence-boosting. Support a local practice that’s helping our kids smile brighter every day!
Website:
https://www.
steinhoffortho.com/
